rev.comment: /* External links */ added a WorldCat link (find books by or about in libraries)
/* Personal life */ just adding a comma
/* Civil War */ 'and the armies fed' -> 'and keep the armies feed'. The writing in this article is brilliant. I just found this sentence slightly jarring and hope that adding 'keep' mitigates that.
What is to be Done? was published in 1902
/* In popular culture */ another Lenin film
/* In popular culture */ Lenin in film
Undid revision 384415551 by [[Special:Contributions/RolandR|RolandR]] ([[User talk:RolandR|talk]]) double to
/* Lenin on anti-Semitism */ Oops: added missing 'T'
/* Civil War */ one image to the left
/* Establishing the Cheka */ Mustn't be in boldface
/* The February Revolution */ using image of same size
Move picture to make block quote more visible.
Date maintenance tags and general fixes: build 490:
Removing "Lenin's_Tomb.jpg", it has been deleted from Commons by [[commons:User:Jameslwoodward|Jameslwoodward]] because: Per [[commons:Commons:Deletion_requests/File:Lenin's_Tomb.jpg]].
Cut down long 'The peaceful development...' blockquote a bit and subbed 'delegates' for 'deputies'
Removed 'five hundred years' pull quote - see Discussion page for explanation
/* Early life and background */ russian ipa is not helpful
/* See also */ adjusting order for relevance
cleaning up lead line, translations and ipa offer little help, make text seem jumbled, old date format is noted in first section
adjusting ipa placement, using common name for box, trying to fix convoluted first line
Citations: [Pu184]Misc citation tidying. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself. [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs here]].
Removed [[:Category:Converts to atheism from Eastern Orthodoxy]]; Adding category [[:Category:Former Eastern Orthodox Christians]] (using [[WP:HOTCAT|HotCat]])
Robot - Speedily moving category Russians of Swedish descent to Russian people of Swedish descent per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
Robot - Speedily moving category Russians of German descent to Russian people of German descent per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
Former caption erroneously implied that he was in exile in 1920
/* Later life and death */ one image of aged Lenin is enough
/* Revolutionary */ Making images of same size
/* Combating anti-Semitism */ Trying to use a uniform size of images, for better readability
/* Later life and death */ some format tweaks
/* Head of government */ rv captions from the titles
/* Early life and background */ rv unencyclopedical titles from captions
/* Russian return */ rv titles in captions which are not so encyclopedical...
/* Revolutionary */ rv wrong use of boldface
/* Early life and background */ Already in boldface
/* Further reading */ ext lk to enigma books
/* Further reading */ add Rappaport. Wklk publishers. Reformat a little.

/* Post-mortem */ This is really not in the least bit contentious. It's almost stating the obvious. See talk page.
Undid revision 358997554 by [[Special:Contributions/SmokeyTheCat|SmokeyTheCat]] ([[User talk:SmokeyTheCat|talk]]) Because it is unsourced,. You must establish the truth of this contentious assertion
/* Post-mortem */ I really can't see the objection to this harmless and reasonable statement
Undid revision 358813853 by [[Special:Contributions/SmokeyTheCat|SmokeyTheCat]] ([[User talk:SmokeyTheCat|talk]]) Remove unsourced commentary
/* Post-mortem */ It is not contentious to say that Lenin is and was controversial

Undid revision 358606333 by [[Special:Contributions/SmokeyTheCat|SmokeyTheCat]] ([[User talk:SmokeyTheCat|talk]]) "Fair comment from common knowledge" is not a reliable source for a contentious statement
/* Post-mortem */ Come on, this is fair comment from common knowledge. It doesn't need a source, one look at the talk page will confirm that Lenin was and is controversial.
Undid revision 358442810 by [[Special:Contributions/SmokeyTheCat|SmokeyTheCat]] ([[User talk:SmokeyTheCat|talk]]) No, that edit and comment cannot be included without a source
/* Post-mortem */ It seems reasonable to say that Lenin was and is a controversial figure

/* Failed assassinations */ rmv unclear "ibid" ref already present anyway
